title: When printing from a website the page is scaled smaller
content:
Hi all,

I've been trying to solve this for a little while but can't find an answer.

I've attached screen shots, as you can see google print preview uses the whole width of the paper to print from a website where as Firefox has huge margins. The only way I've fixed this is to change to scale and tweak around. Only problem with this is that it then will affect other printing functions and need to switch back to fit to page width.

I'm sure there must be something I'm not doing right

Thanks in advance

title: Al hacer clic sobre un enlace de descarga no ofrece la opción Abrir
content: Hola. Desde hace unos días, cuando hago clic sobre un archivo de Word, PowerPoint y otros muchos tipos de archivos, no se abre la ventana en la que se ofrecía la opción de Abrir, Abrir en firefox y Descargar. Únicamente se abre la ventana para elegir la carpeta de descarga (ya que lo tengo configurado para preguntar dónde realizar la descarga), pero no puedo abrirlo directamente. He recurrido al artículo de Administrar los diferentes tipos de descargas: https://support.mozilla.org/es/kb/Administrar%20los%20diferentes%20tipos%20de%20archivo#w_cambiar-las-acciones-de-las-descargas Pero es inútil. He intentado Cambiar las acciones de descargas y añadir aplicaciones, pero no funciona porque el tipo de archivo no está en la lista en Aplicaciones Tampoco he podido Añadir nuevas acciones para la descarga, porque no me ofrece la posibilidad. He intentado restablecer las opciones de descarga borrando handlers.json He desinstalado firefox borrando todo rastro de él en el ordenador y cuando vuelvo a instalarlo sigue en la misma situación. Por si fuera un problema de plugins, después de reinstalarlo, no puse ningún plugin y seguía haciendo lo mismo. ¿Qué puedo hacer? Porque si no puedo resolverlo tendré que cambiar de navegador después de estar usando Firefox como predeterminado desde siempre. Un saludo.
creator: ludoronode

title: The connection was reset
content:
The connection to the server was reset while the page was loading. 

   The site could be temporarily unavailable or too busy. Try again in a few moments.    If you are unable to load any pages, check your computer’s network connection.    If your computer or network is protected by a firewall or proxy, make sure that Waterfox is permitted to access the Web.

title: Firefox downloads files to wrong locations
content:
It started about last week - Firefox completely changed its behavior regarding opening files.

How it worked before: When I download a file, I'm being asked if I want to download it, or open it. If I choose download it, it opens a dialog window to ask me where to save it, suggesting Desktop as default choice. If I choose to open the file, it gets downloaded to Temp and opened. Because it's in Temp, the file eventually gets cleaned up by my OS.

How it works now: If I choose to download, it works normally, asks me where to save it, suggests Desktop. When I choose to open the file, it gets downloaded to my Desktop and opened. After that it stays on my Desktop forever, and I have to delete it by hand, which kills the whole point of "open vs download".

How can I restore the previous behavior? It's extremely annoying. Attached are my settings regarding file saving. They haven't been changed, I've had them like this for years.
creator: arturbobik

title: downloading mobi and AZW3 files
content: When I click on a download link for mobi and AZW3 files, I want a box to pop up and ask me whether I want to open or save. I have two different apps on my computer that will open those types of files. I went to this page (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/change-firefox-behavior-when-open-file) and found some info, but it didn't help me. In the "Adding download actions" section, when I right click on the mobi file that I just downloaded, I don't get the option "Always Open Similar Files" on that little drop down menu that shows up. How do I get Firefox to recognize that I have an app on the computer that will open those files? This problem only started with the new update a few days ago. Before that I always got the box that asked me Open or Save on any ebook download link I clicked on.
creator: carolcobun

title: Cannot access accounts - Access Denied / Warning: Potential Security Risk Ahead
content: I have several different types of accounts that I cannot access via Firefox. But, I can access these through MS Internet Explorer. Firefox is becoming useless to me. The accounts include banking, insurance, travel, government, etc. This has been on ongoing problem for several weeks. I first realized it with an airline more than a year ago. In Firefox, I have tried to delete cookies, to forget about the site. I have tried changing various protection and security switches. Nothing seems to help. Please see the attached screen shots of return messages. Some messages that say it is a problem with the website and I need to contact that administrator. However, I am able to immediately go to MS Internet Explorer and get into the account. I have read community helps and note that other people have these same problems. And, I have read their frustration as nothing seems to help. I would appreciate some advice that works. I like Firefox better than other browsers and do not want to change. Thanks.
creator: 01july1953

title: Downloads display
content:
Recently, the way downloads/files saved are shown has changed. Instead of the arrow turning blue, there's now a box that pops up and stays up until you click something else. That box and all previous saves are shown every time. (Versus previously, when you could hover over or click the gone-blue icon to see your downloads.)

Is there a way to turn this off? It's pretty annoying.

title: after updating firefox 97 to 98, no more sound within firefox
content:
I deinstalled firefox 98 completely from my Xubuntu 20.04.4 I then deleted all firefox related things from ~/.cache and ~/.config I rebooted I newly installed Firefox 98 from repository. Firefox 98 still does not produce sounds. Even a local file:///home/rp/Music/testfile.mp3 runs but does not produce audio output (it worked fine in Firefox 97). The Volume display is showing max. value. Firefox is even visible as stream in sound system's Volume Control / Playback (when the mp3 file is running) with 100% On my system, audio works fine with chromium browser as well as all other audio apps - as before. The earlier release Firefox 97 ran fine and produced audio output as it should. Firefox 98 currently runs without additional add-ons (no one installed besides the default Open H264 Video Codec).

What can I do to get Firefox 98 to output sound?

title: Thumbnail preview on taskbar displays in list form
content:
I am running Firefox in 64bit Windows 10 with 16GB ram, intel core processor and more than a TB free on each drive. I currently have two Firefox browser windows open, one with four tabs and the other with seventeen. Ordinarily when I click on the Firefox icon in the taskbar it displays a thumbnail of the two windows and whichever page is active in those windows. Recently, however, it has been displaying all of the open webpages in list format, instead of the thumbnails.

The behavior is inconsistent and I have not been able to determine a pattern, but the list is becoming more common and makes it more difficult to locate the page I was on. The issue began after my data hard-drive crashed, which held certain Firefox files despite the operating system being on another drive. But now that I have replaced the drive, the problem persists and I am not certain the issue was related to the crash at all.

Does anyone know what might be causing this behavior? I have attached screen shots of both the list and thumbnail views I am referring to.
creator: wynden
